comment: Very nice professor. Posts explanations for every topic.Homework can be time consuming. Don't slack off-start reviewing early as final is cumulative and worth 20% of your grade. You must get at least a 50% it or you'll automatically get a D in the class,no matter your overall grade. Great class if you stay on top of everything

In highschool I sucked at math, this is the first year I recieved an A. I loved this teacher, she is super nice and caring! The work isn't easy but if you study and do the homework you will be just fine! She only gave us four test during the semester, one final, but no quizzes or midterm. She is really understanding when needing an extension.

I enjoyed this class throughout the semester. she offers morning tutoring and opportunities to make up tests if you fail them. However, I maintained As on all of the assignments & tests and then at the very end of the semester I received a low grade, but wasn't given an opportunity to improve. I got an 89.3...and was told to have a growth mindset.

Professor Iscimen was super kind & understanding! She'd provide straightforward & easy homework, about 5 quizzes & 2 exams throughout the semester (all in-person). She provides office hours that work well with her students' schedules & an online review session before the final. Totally recommend as she genuinely cares for her student!

She is so nice and genuinely wants what is best for you. She wants you to learn.
She doesn't really use her time wisely but still a pretty good lecture.
Attendance is part of your grade.
A good bit of work to be done outside of class.
In-person tests & cumulative final
She is such a laid back professor and will help you until you understand the material. A little talk-heavy and doesn't necessarily use time wisely, but overall very very understanding and will help.

Very easy class; just do your work. The professor was great; even though it was online, she did the best she could to help us understand the math topics. Each test has a study guide, so like I said again, just do your homework and study guide, and you should have an A, not a B, but an A in this class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Iscimen is a great instructor. She is a very understanding and accommodating prof. I truly learned a lot in this course. You are graded by 3 tests a couple of quizzes and a handful of homework assignments. The exams are extremely long and quite difficult but she sets you up for success if you use her study guides. I recommend taking her!

She was one of the best math professors i have ever had. She was very understanding and was always happy to help when someone had a hard time with the work. In my class i just wished my peers respected her more but she never let that stop her from being so positive. 10/10 recommend Dr. Iscimen as a professor. Just do you work and pay attention.

This professor was always very helpful. She does give some homework but it is rarely graded you usually just go over them in class. Her quizzes and test were not too hard but you do have to study some before and she will give a study guide. Attendance is part of your grade but if you miss less than like five it won't effect your grade.

this professor is very nice, communicative, and tries her best to be understanding & work with you! attendance is only 5% of your grade, gives practice hw (not graded), allows you to work in groups, drops your lowest quiz grade, and overall gives quizzes every other week! her class is fairly easy (i just suck at math lol) just pay attention!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: She was great! She answered questions and explained everything thoroughly. She used ALEKS for homework and study guides. For each test there was study guide and the tests were made up of topics covered on the study guides.
She's okay. Gives lots of homework, but is usually easy. Never puts grades in though.

This was one of the hardest courses I have ever taken. There is a lot of homework, and a lot of quizzes, to say they were helpful would be partially a lie. I can not express how much this class overwhelmed me. She is a very caring person and very understanding, she is also very intelligent in mathematics. Just make sure you work and are prepared.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: I want to start off with the positives, she is so sweet she wouldn't harm a snail. She was understanding when it came to personal matters and she is always willing to help. Now the downside, imagine walking on a treadmill at five mph with a 12 incline. That is how this class is, I do not even remember what I learned I barely made it out. NOTES,READ
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Her class was very easy and very independent. Her class mainly relies on ALEKS. She prepares you for each test with a study guide. The study guide and test look VERY familiar with each other. There is alot of homework but if you do good on the initial knowledge check you will have less homework. (15+ homework assignments/weekly)

Not sure why she has bad ratings. She was a very nice teacher, perhaps even too nice. If she assigned homework problems that didn't need to be turned in, she pretty much expected that no one did them and was nice about it. I enjoy math and had no difficulty in this class. If you pay attention, take notes, do the readings/hw you should be fine.

Dog I took this class last semester and that was the worst decision of my life. Its hard to understand her she never grades on time and if you want to drop this class good luck knowing if you should or not. She doesnt grade until the end of the semester. She gives homework but doesnt grade half of it
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: I took her online, and the class pretty much relies on ALEKS for all homework and tests. You'll have to be consistent with completing your HW on time as you teach yourself everything. Just take good lesson notes and do 3-4 HW lessons a day prior to a deadline and you'll be fine. I hardly had any interaction with the professor. This class is all you
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Participation matters

comment: So much homework! I did the math and at bare minimum youre doing at least 60 questions a week. You could be doing more than that. Thats just the homework. That doesnt include all the practice problems the textbook has. A class my BF took, he said they only did like 10 problems a week. This is on average 20 topics a week. Its way too much!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: I loved Dr. Iscimen! She is very caring and easy to get in touch with if you need help. My best advice is to do the online homework and you will pass every test. She gives reviews for every test including the midterm and final. She dropped our lowest test or quiz grade. Would take again!

I absolutely loved taking her class this semester. She was responsive to feedback we gave her about the speed of her lecture and would always redo problems over if someone didn't understand. I wish I could have her for every math class I have to take. We covered a lot each class, so it was important to go, but she makes it interesting enough.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Go to class and take notes. She will help you if you need help and go over things with you if you need her to however you need to understand the material yourself in order to do well in the class. The material she teaches is the very thing you need to know to teach younger children. She is awesome and I would definitely take her again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Professor Iscimen is wonderful! She is very knowledgeable and really makes sure you know the material. She helps you understand why your future students may solve math problems a certain way and how to work through them. I am taking her again this semester for 3316 and cant wait to learn more from her!

Professor Iscimen is a caring and very knowledgeable mathematician. There was quite a bit of tests, quizzes, and homework, but it was all manageable. Overall as long as you put in the effort you'll pass the class. She teaches the core concepts well and it just takes a little practice to fully understand whats being taught.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: I took this class as an elective thinking it would be easy it is not. She makes things so serious than they really are. test are all short answer and takes off poitns for every single thing.

Did not expect this class to be anything other than an easy A however I'll be thankful to make a C. She goes way too fast through the material and I can't keep up. It's relatively easy material, she just teaches it in a confusing way and does not make clear what she wants on assignments.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Math 2008 Professor Iscimen is knowledgeable about the criteria. A few tests, quizzes, and assignments but they are not hard if you show up to class, pay attention, and take notes. Bought textbook and never even cracked it open. Materials that were required were never used either.

The class is super easy since it's literally K-3 grade math. She gives good instruction too. However she doesn't even grade everything she assigns to do outside of class which is annoying. So if you miss one assignment expect to have a low grade in the class because the zero makes a big difference. Her test are fairly easy though.

Dr. Iscimen (formally Ersoz) is a wonderful professor. She's been very helpful, answers any questions with care. Goes over quizzes & tests after they've been graded. She cares about the students. We have 2 tests, then a final (3 in total), quizzes throughout the semester, graded assignments, and homework (not graded). I plan to take her again.
